title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 October 2015 - XWiki
content:
<sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
01:16 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit

03:36 <sbaloul2> has quit

08:08 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <msmeria1> has quit  
08:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:31 <cjd> has quit  
09:02 <Ramona1> has quit  
09:05 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <vmassol> good morning  
09:30 <vmassol> I have a REST question  
09:30 <vmassol> I'm using this search query to list all users:  
09:30 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/rest/wikis/query?q=object:XWiki.XWikiUsers&wikis=xwiki&className=XWiki.XWikiUsers  
09:31 <vmassol> now I was expecting the className param to provide data in the result  
09:31 <vmassol> the doc says: " If className is specified, the result will also contain the data for the first object of the corresponding class."  
09:31 <vmassol> is this a bug?  
09:31 <vmassol> (or should I use it differently?)  
09:32 <tmortagne> never used object search API  
09:33 <tmortagne> Enygma`: Hi  
09:34 <vmassol> I think we're missing rest apis around users (even though they're objects). Would make it simpler for our users  
09:34 <tmortagne> the failing tests on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/2044/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-administration-test-tests/testReport/ seems related directly or indirectly to your change on template handling  
09:34 <tmortagne> vmassol: we are missing user related API pretty much everywhere  
09:34 <vmassol> yes…  
09:37 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <vmassol> ok I'll report a bug for the search api  
09:42 <Enygma`> tmortagne: yes, I`m about to commit a fix  
09:42 <tmortagne> ok cool  
09:42 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <vmassol> nice: https://travis-ci.org/xwiki-contrib/api-xff  
10:04 <tmortagne> yep travis integration with github is quite nice  
10:04 <cjd> it only works w/ github  
10:04 <cjd> also gm  
10:05 <tmortagne> you get an automatic build for all pull request too with a marker telling you if it's passing or not in the pull request UI itself before you apply  
10:05 <vmassol> yes  
10:05 <cjd> yeah, that is really wonderful  
10:05 <vmassol> could be nice for our contrib projects. Would need to check if we can make it work with selenium (I think I checked and it can work)  
10:06 <cjd> I think it kills your build if it takes >10mn  
10:06 <cjd> so you need to fix the build in order to use it :)  
10:06 <vmassol> now api-xff took 5mn to build that's a lot  
10:06 <cjd> yeah :(  
10:06 <vmassol> not our fault  
10:06 <tmortagne> yep I remember there is some limitation but don't remember which one, jdeb is pretty small thing to build  
10:07 <cjd> well in the end it's always our fault, even if only because we picked faulty tools  
10:07 <vmassol> "Unlimited Build Minutes"  
10:07 <vmassol> https://travis-ci.com/plans  
10:07 <vmassol> (for open source)  
10:07 <vmassol> cjd: not really  
10:07 <vmassol> we don't conrol the cpu they use  
10:07 <vmassol> \*control  
10:08 <vmassol> and locally I'm sure it takes under 1 minute  
10:08 <vmassol> so it has to be their fault  
10:08 <tmortagne> I think travis is shared resources so it depends how many project are building at the same time  
10:08 <cjd> hmm last cjdns build was 23 seconds  
10:08 <cjd> https://travis-ci.org/cjdelisle/cjdns  
10:08 <vmassol> you're right cjd: https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/3849  
10:09 <vmassol> at least in may that's what they were doing apparnetly  
10:09 <vmassol> killing if no output is received within 10 minutes  
10:09 <vmassol> but that's ok  
10:09 <vmassol> we don't do that  
10:09 <vmassol> we send back output  
10:09 <vmassol> as we progress  
10:09 <tmortagne> yep  
10:09 <tmortagne> and I can understand the need  
10:09 <tmortagne> they could end up with tons on ghosts otherwise  
10:10 <vmassol> sure, it's a good thing  
10:10 <vmassol> what I'm saying is that I don't think this would be a problem for us  
10:10 <vmassol> unless their cpu is really slow  
10:10 <vmassol> maybe for the gwt compilation for ex  
10:10 <cjd> hmm  
10:11 <cjd> Just did a scan of c and h files in cjdns project  
10:11 <cjd> totals 5,496,395  
10:11 <cjd> lines of code  
10:11 <cjd> and whitespace and comments  
10:11 <cjd> 23 seconds  
10:11 <cjd> (travis builds everything from scratch)  
10:11 <vmassol> just did a check on my assembly code 1M lines of code and it executes in 5 seconds  
10:11 <vmassol> you're beaten cjd!  
10:12 <cjd> where?  
10:12 <vmassol> that's becasue you're using a slow language  
10:12 <vmassol> you should use binary directly  
10:12 <tmortagne> I doubt the actual java compilation is what takes most of the time  
10:12 <cjd> where is your asm ? I wanna code-review it :P  
10:12 <vmassol> cjd: please stop comparing cjdns with xwiki it makes no sense on any point  
10:12 <cjd> ahh this morning is starting off great <trollface>  
10:13 <vmassol> :)  
10:14 <cjd> well I understand that there are limitations which XWiki has to deal with, but on the other hand I don't want to let you off the hook saying "not our fault, slow machine"  
10:15 <vmassol> oh yes we should definitely keep searching for ideas to improve our build  
10:15 <cjd> truth lies somewhere in between  
10:15 <vmassol> but comparing cjdns doesn't help  
10:15 <cjd> I only pull that comparison when you pull the "this is just fine, it's not our fault" :)  
10:15 <vmassol> it's simple  
10:16 <vmassol> build api-xff locally  
10:16 <vmassol> if it takes 5 minutes then I'll admit my mistake  
10:16 <vmassol> (haven't tried yet)  
10:16 <cjd> probably longer because empty maven local repo  
10:16 <vmassol> jean seems to have added a cache  
10:16 <vmassol> AFAICS  
10:16 <vmassol> (but I'm no travis expert)  
10:17 <vmassol> maybe it'll kick in for the next build  
10:17 <vmassol> so indeed 5mn to get all deps seems a good explanation  
10:17 <vmassol> but I didn't see that in the console logs  
10:18 <vmassol> for ex: https://travis-ci.org/xwiki-contrib/api-xff/jobs/87626547  
10:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
10:18 <vmassol> Total time: 34.740 s  
10:18 <cjd> cool  
10:19 <vmassol> apparently they run it twice  
10:19 <vmassol> mvn install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -B -V  
10:20 <vmassol> and then mvn test -B  
10:22 <vmassol> oh didn't know about this, nice :)  
10:22 <vmassol> https://www.codacy.com/app/woshilapin/api-xff/dashboard  
10:24 <vmassol> very nice: "Impact of every Commit and Pull Request" at https://www.codacy.com/  
10:26 <vmassol> hey nice too: sends comments in your PR  
10:26 <vmassol> (or jenkins)  
10:34 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <tmortagne> vmassol: you have missing documentation on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12718  
10:47 <tmortagne> mflorea: any idea if http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/2045/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-xclass-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.xclass.test.ui/ClassSheetTest/createClass/ is related to your work on XClass ?  
10:47 <tmortagne> also if you have an idea of what caused 34 failing Wysiwyg tests  
10:48 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne, I'll add doc for it in 15mn  
10:48 <tmortagne> I looks at some of them and they seems to be caused by some wrong html rendering  
10:48 <tmortagne> looked  
10:48 <tmortagne> it started around 20th of October it seems  
10:48 <tmortagne> but I don't see any commit that could be related on that date  
10:49 <Inge-> has quit  
10:51 <tmortagne> we still have quite a few issue open for 7.3M2...  
10:51 <tmortagne> vmassol: we keep pushing XWIKI-12165, either it's a real blocker and we should fix it or we lower it's priority  
10:52 <mflorea> tmortagne: re class sheet, yes most probably caused by my changes. I'll handle it asap. I'm finishing with http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12430 first  
10:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: we can lower it, even though it's a regression. Denis1: would be great to know when you can work on it :)  
10:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: when do you plan to finish XWIKI-12605 ?  
10:55 <vmassol> doc fixed  
10:56 <vmassol> ah yes I had forgotten about it, I should hace done it in M2  
10:56 <vmassol> unfortunately now I won't have time before 7.4M1  
10:56 <vmassol> so you could push it to 7.4M1  
10:56 <vmassol> I'll do it  
10:57 <vmassol> done  
10:57 <vmassol> thanks  
10:58 <mflorea> tmortagne: re wysiwyg tests, seems like the browser is not behaving as expected. Either we upgraded Selenium but we didn't upgrade the Firefox version on the agents, or we upgraded the Firefox version on the agents without upgrading Selenium. I'll take a look later  
10:58 <tmortagne> I did see a selenium upgrade recently  
10:58 <vmassol> I did one upgrade yes  
10:58 <vmassol> I tested on a few func tests locally and it worked but it's possible it causes some problems  
10:58 <vmassol> in which case we should revert and reopen the jira issue  
10:58 <tmortagne> anyway we should definitely upgrade FF on our agents since we did not do it in a while  
10:59 <vmassol> or upgrade the FF on the agents if that's the problem  
10:59 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
11:00 <tmortagne> indeed I only looked at platform commits and selenium upgrade was just before wysiwyg start failing  
11:01 <tmortagne> looking at what is the supported version of FF in Selenium 2.45.0  
11:01 <Denis> vmassol: Sorry, but I will not have time soon, I am actually fully overloaded…  
11:04 <tmortagne> reverting Selenium for now  
11:23 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne (for the revert)  
12:02 <helge> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <helge> Hello, I have a question regarding the publication workflow application  
12:03 <helge> Is there a simple way to disable the hide/unhide documents in the workflow functionality?  
12:05 <helge> Edit-rights are perfectly managed by that app, but hiding documents can be over the top. Contributors loose sight of documents.  
12:06 <helge> I could not find anything in the .xar. Maybe this is coded in the api?

16:59 <mflorea1> yep, I'm looking at the failing tests first and then handle the doc  
17:09 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:25 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
17:38 <Trefex> has quit  
17:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: so I guess we won't be releasing today right?  
17:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: yep  
17:48 <vmassol> I really hope we can do that tomorrow since we're starting to drift  
17:48 <vmassol> and we don't have much time left  
17:48 <tmortagne> tomorrow morning I hope  
17:48 <vmassol> ok  
17:49 <vmassol> ci is prety redish/yellowish ATM :)  
17:49 <vmassol> \*pretty  
17:50 <vmassol> I'm eager to try mflorea1's new tree in the breadcrumbs!  
17:51 <mflorea1> vmassol: I'm eager to see if it meets the expectations :P  
17:51 <vmassol> hehe  
17:52 <vmassol> I was watiing for the ci to build platform for me  
17:52 <vmassol> but it's not going to happen anytime soon I think  
17:52 <mflorea1> it's a first version anyway, we can adjust it during RC1  
17:52 <vmassol> what do I need to build it locally?  
17:52 <mflorea1> flamingo skin and platform-web  
17:52 <vmassol> k thanks  
17:53 <vmassol> new tree ?  
17:53 <vmassol> (I mean the moved one)  
17:53 <vmassol> I guess so  
17:53 <mflorea1> no, because we didn't move the page in the wiki  
17:53 <vmassol> ok  
17:53 <mflorea1> just the location on the fs  
17:54 <vmassol> yup ok  
17:54 <mflorea1> there's nothing to compile, you could just copy the files from https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/27a4fcba6302995e9dcea142c0f4555bd37981d0 on a recent version of XWiki, but you'll have to trigger a less recompilation by saving the color theme
